alert.note: Alert for Sumter (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 4:44PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Dooly, southeastern Sumter and western Crisp Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 440 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Desoto, or 12 miles southeast of Americus, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Cordele, Vienna, Leslie, Lilly, De Soto, Desoto, Cobb, Fort Early, Drayton, Georgia Veterans Memorial St Pk, Richwood and Raines. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
